newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian 1996 budget deficit 724.36 mln litas.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian 1996 budget deficit 724.36 mln litas.

text.p: Lithuania's finance ministry said on Monday the country's 1996 budget deficit was 724.363 million litas ($181.2 million), exceeding a planned deficit of 704 million litas.
The ministry said in a statement that both revenue and expenditure fell short of the targets set by the previous government of ex-Communists, which was ousted in elections in November 1996.
In revenues, the ministry said it collected 4.627 billion litas in 1996 and spent 5.351 billion litas.
The ministry said it had planned revenues of 4.898 billion litas, 271.33 million litas more than collected.
Spending was set at 5.668 billion litas, 316.745 million litas more than actually spent in 1996.
Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius' new right-wing government has set a 1997 budget deficit of 697 million litas.
